repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: J. Walter Thompson Company. Jack Stevens papers
did.abstract: Founded in 1864, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. Jack Stevens was Chairman and CEO of Deltakos, a JWT subsidiary focused on the science and medical industries. Deltakos, later known as the JWT Healthcare Group, was absorbed in a merger with Ferguson Communications in 1993.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: John (Jack) Stevens. BA 1956, Fairfield University; JD 1966 Chase College. Sales and marketing, Pfizer, c. 1960-1967. Joined JWT 1967 as account representative for Eli Lilly; Account Supervisor for Oral-B c. 1969; President, Deltakos 1975. Retained position when Deltakos merged with Ferguson Communications 1993.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company. Jack Stevens papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 1993.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company. Jack Stevens papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 1993-084

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center collections:

J. Walter Thompson Company Frankfurt Office George Black papers; J. Walter Thompson Company Frankfurt Office Herbert Brungs papers; J. Walter Thompson Company Frankfurt Office Burkhard Schwarz papers; J. Walter Thompson Company Hugh Connell papers; J. Walter Thompson Company Don Johnston papers; J. Walter Thompson Company Information Center records; J. Walter Thompson Company Review Board records; J. Walter Thompson Company Account Files; J. Walter Thompson Company Domestic Advertisements; J. Walter Thompson Company International Advertisements; J. Walter Thompson Company Brouillard Communications Vertical Files; Arthur Einstein papers.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection spans 1970-1990 and includes correspondence, memoranda, press releases, client contact reports and other printed materials relating to the management of JWT Healthcare/Deltakos and relations with its clients including Eli Lilly. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.
